ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Great to have structured format to pursue write up and presentation of a formal paper. appreciated being in it, and gained value from being exposed to science students doing write ups, data analysis even though i wasn't (non-traditional class member). Increased my science literacy. Great structure for MA project work.

This class' name should be changed to Advanced Research Seminar. I never would have heard or have gone to this class based on the title alone; it does not encompass what the class is really about... advancing our own research that goes well beyond Silviculture.More of these classes should be offered. For example 3 courses: 1 for natural science, a second for social science, and a third for interdisciplinary science.This course has been invaluable in helping students advanced their own research. After taking Research Methods our first semester, there has been NO OTHER guidance in how to analyze, interpret, and write up our data and results.This class should be used as a model to create other classes that give all MESc students the opportunity to advance their research.Mark Ashton is a great professor!

This course a very practical seminar. It provides students interested in research critical tools to undertake excellent scholarship. It also gives the student opportunities to be evaluated several times. This course is what i will personally refer to as hands-on!

7b) Elaine was absolutely incredible and generous. The statistical feedback she provided was unparalleled and extremely important to everyone in this class. Without Elaine this class would still be good, but it wouldn't be half as great.10) This course was critical to the write-up of my degree research. I found the two semesters of this course to be considerably more valuable than Research Methods.
access to mark and elaine's and peer's presentation criticism.
The help, structure, and guidance it provided.
Highly interactive and discussional
I was able to work on my thesis and keep up with presentations given throughout the year.

Opportunity to have someone (TA) to take a detailed look at the statistical analysis that I had performed.The chance to practice the presentation that I gave at the Masters Research Colloquium approximately half a dozen times before the actual event, plus get professor and student feedback.Getting Mark Ashton's advice on both the research write-up and the appropriate journal.This class provided structure to my research, which would have been entirely lacking in the second year. I'm not sure that I would have finished the analysis (let alone finished it properly) without this class!
Feedback from Prof Ashton and other students.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Some deadlines second semester.

A schedule for the second semester of the class should be created by the professor at the beginning of the term and distributed. The plan for class was often created the week before, a few days before, and sometimes even the afternoon before class. This reduced student investment and also reduced the quality of what we produced because we couldn't plan ahead.Feedback on drafts sometimes took much longer to be returned than expected/appropriate. In particular, feedback on colloquium abstracts took a very long time to be sent.The course title should be adjusted so that it is more apparent what the course covers and the course should also be approved to qualify as research credits for MESC and MFS students.I think that the order in which topics are addressed by this seminar should be changed. It would have been most helpful to start the year off by working on statistical analysis and results and to make that the focus of the first semester. The introduction, methods, abstract, discussion, etc. could then have been tackled in the second semester.
Everything was great.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Very helpful.
Instructor not always responsive to emails. TA very helpful, especially with data analysis.
The Instructor and TA were readily available. I received great help from both.
very available and high quality.

Elaine made herself incredibly available in the spring and gave up several hours to work through statistical issues. Can't possibly thank her enough for this availability and patience.Mark gave thorough feedback in class, such that I didn't often find it necessary to request additional guidance outside of class hours.
Extremely helpful and responsive

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: ma project.
All MESc students need this class!
This course fits well in my overall academic and training goals. It gave me the opportunity to appreciate better scholarship in silviculture and other related-disciplines
It was applicable to my paper and degree requirements.
Might not have finished my research write-up without this class! I think it should be a must for all MFS and maybe many MESC students.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: ma project structure.
To help with my research.
It was part of my academic and training needs

My advisor wasn't inclined to provide structure during my second year as I wrapped up my research. I knew that I needed deadlines and structure in order to finish up the work, because it was too easy to put other class demands first. This class made my research something I couldn't neglect and also raised my expectations for what I produced.

comments: yes
Yes
Yes!
yes
Exceeded. I didn't expect so much excellent statistical advice!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Present as much as you can, great experience building.
Take it despite its name!
Please take it!
keep up with the work.
Start your stats/data analysis as early as you can in the first semester! Run through your work with Elaine and attend the crash stats sessions she gives on ANOVA and regression methods.

This is one of the most useful and rewarding courses I took at FES and all students regardless of degree (MEM, MF, MFS, MESC) should have the opportunity to take a course like this. I highly recommend this course to anyone working on a big project (whether research based or otherwise) regardless of degree or focus.
